contentrichtext.text: {{two other uses|the historical province|the modern region|Varsinais-Suomi|other uses|Varsinais-Suomi (disambiguation)}} [[Image:Historical province of Finland Proper in Finland.png|left|150px|thumb|Historical province of Southwest Finland<br>(borders of the modern provinces,<br>i.e. regions with pink colour)]][[Image:Varsinais-Suomen.vaakuna.svg|right|150px]] '''Southwest Finland''' or '''Finland Proper''' ({{lang-fi|Varsinais-Suomi}}, {{lang-sv|Egentliga Finland}}, {{lang-la|Ducatus Finlandiae Meridionalis}}), is a [[Historical provinces of Finland|historical province]] in south western [[Finland]], centred on the historic city of [[Turku]] (Swedish: Åbo) and the [[Turku Castle]]. It borders [[Satakunta (historical province)|Satakunta]], [[Tavastia (historical province)|Tavastia]] and [[Uusimaa]]. It is also bounded by the [[Baltic sea]] facing [[Åland]]. There is also a modern [[Regions of Finland|region]] by the name [[Finland Proper (region)|Finland Proper]]. Finland Proper is not to be confused with [[Mainland Finland]]. == Administration == '''Southwest Finland''' was comprised within the boundaries of the administrative province of [[Turku and Pori Province|Turku and Pori]] from 1917 to 1997 and that of [[Western Finland]] from 1997 to 2009, when the provinces of Finland were abolished. == History == The province, which had been a part of [[Sweden]] from the 13th century, separated when Finland was ceded to [[Russia]] in 1809. The [[Provinces of Sweden|provinces]] has no administrative function today but lives on as a historical legacy in both countries. Originally ''Finland'' referred only to this region but later replaced the traditional [[Österland]] (Eastern land) in meaning. == Heraldry == Arms granted at the burial of [[Gustav I of Sweden]] in 1560. The arms is crowned by a ducal coronet, though by Finnish tradition this more resembles a Swedish comital coronet. Blazon: "Gules, a crowned jousting helmet in front of two lances in saltire, all Or. On each lance is attached a forked hanging flag azure, charged with a Scandinavian cross Or." == External links == * [http://www.fotw.net/flags/fi-v.html '''Southwest Finland''' at ''Flags of the World''] {{Historical provinces of Finland}} {{coord missing|Finland}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Southwest Finland(Historical Province)}} [[Category:Historical provinces of Finland]] [[Category:Finland Proper| ]] [[Category:Medieval Finland]] [[Category:Western Finland]]
